basis: The user consistently articulates concrete, multi-part plans with environment- and mood-tracking, indicating a reasonable likelihood of action. However, historically there has been variability in follow-through, so the predicted action is moderate rather than high.
coaching_notes: To improve follow-through, consider simplifying logging to reduce cognitive load (e.g., combine mood/urge with triggers in one quick entry). Encourage preparation (pre-packed snacks) and establish simple prompts or accountability (short post-lunch check-in). Explore and address barriers like overwhelm or perfectionism; reframe slips as data and learning opportunities rather than failures.
